page.title: 03Donington Park Race Track
page.content: Donington Park Racing Circuit is privately owned and was re-opened for motor racing in 1977, having not been used since before the 2nd World War. Race meetings are held most weekends throughout the summer and on some weekends during the rest of the year.There are two or three events a year which attract crowds of 60-70000 people. With the ultimate aim of holding a Formula 1 Grand Prix, the track has recently been extended and work is in progress to improve facilities for spectators and competitors. Throughout the year the circuit is available for hire for the testing and practising of cars and motorcycles and is also used for promotional events. It provides employment for 20 full time staff and many casual staff on meeting days.
